results.content:
I liked the enthusiasm in the trainer's voice which made the learning more interesting and also the pace of the course is fairly good. Not too slow or too fast. 
My only disappointment with this course is the trainer has not included the approach with which he came up with all the dimensions. If only that addition could be made too, then I wouldn't mind rating it 5-stars.
results.content_html:
I liked the enthusiasm in the trainer's voice which made the learning more interesting and also the pace of the course is fairly good. Not too slow or too fast.
My only disappointment with this course is the trainer has not included the approach with which he came up with all the dimensions. If only that addition could be made too, then I wouldn't mind rating it 5-stars.

results.content:
I have been working with web design for a bit of time, but have struggled with the initial layouts.  I stumbled on the concept of wireframes instead of layouts and found this course.

It was exactly what I was looking for.  The idea of creating the framework and ignoring the design (fonts, images, etc) is brilliant!   Would love to find more courses by Geoff, rather than listing by Stone River eLearning.
results.content_html:
I have been working with web design for a bit of time, but have struggled with the initial layouts. I stumbled on the concept of wireframes instead of layouts and found this course.

It was exactly what I was looking for. The idea of creating the framework and ignoring the design (fonts, images, etc) is brilliant! Would love to find more courses by Geoff, rather than listing by Stone River eLearning.

results.content: Overall, Geoff has a very casual and easy to follow teaching style. Most of the things taught here are timeless and easy to use. There were a couple sections where I was thinking of other ways I'd do the same thing, but this just shows the flexibility of the methods taught.
results.content_html: Overall, Geoff has a very casual and easy to follow teaching style. Most of the things taught here are timeless and easy to use. There were a couple sections where I was thinking of other ways I'd do the same thing, but this just shows the flexibility of the methods taught.

results.content: This course is exactly what I was looking for to develop wireframes for my websites. The content was spot on and the instructor was engaging, positive, high-energy, entertaining, and very informative!
results.content_html: This course is exactly what I was looking for to develop wireframes for my websites. The content was spot on and the instructor was engaging, positive, high-energy, entertaining, and very informative!

results.content:
Great Course with some really handy time saver tips in wireframing.  However, the final code has not been made available and very little explanation of the aspect ratio made it difficult to digest.

I'd highly recommend this to accelerate your development workflow. 

However, A little more elaboration on the chosen aspect ratios would most definitely take this course further!
results.content_html:
Great Course with some really handy time saver tips in wireframing. However, the final code has not been made available and very little explanation of the aspect ratio made it difficult to digest.

I'd highly recommend this to accelerate your development workflow.

However, A little more elaboration on the chosen aspect ratios would most definitely take this course further!

results.content: I've had a little time to go through the course now and it has value with regard to wire framing.  Unfortunately, there does not appear to be any engagement by the instructor.  Which is something I am used to with other instructors.   If have previous experience with html and css this course will be of use.  What is more I am not really a fan of the way he structures his code.  Especially his CSS.  Everything within the brackets on one line.  Makes it hard to read.  But, I see why he may be doing it this way.  To keep the code all on the screen to view.
results.content_html: I've had a little time to go through the course now and it has value with regard to wire framing. Unfortunately, there does not appear to be any engagement by the instructor. Which is something I am used to with other instructors. If have previous experience with html and css this course will be of use. What is more I am not really a fan of the way he structures his code. Especially his CSS. Everything within the brackets on one line. Makes it hard to read. But, I see why he may be doing it this way. To keep the code all on the screen to view.

results.content: Excellent course. I highly recommend it to others. I'm giving it five stars because the instructor is knowledgeable, speaks clearly, is organized, and imparts a lot of valuable information. My only disappointment was that he calculated all of the dimensions in the layout beforehand and did not explain those dimensions or his process in arriving at them in the course. Even so, I was able to make all of the instructions work, and the course was excellent practice with html and css. If you're a beginning or intermediate coder, the course will advance your knowledge.
results.content_html: Excellent course. I highly recommend it to others. I'm giving it five stars because the instructor is knowledgeable, speaks clearly, is organized, and imparts a lot of valuable information. My only disappointment was that he calculated all of the dimensions in the layout beforehand and did not explain those dimensions or his process in arriving at them in the course. Even so, I was able to make all of the instructions work, and the course was excellent practice with html and css. If you're a beginning or intermediate coder, the course will advance your knowledge.

results.content: Now that I see how easy it is to wireframe with code, that is what I will do. The only thing I would have liked as an addition to the course: I would have liked to have seen you draw the stuff on paper and how you figured that part out.
results.content_html: Now that I see how easy it is to wireframe with code, that is what I will do. The only thing I would have liked as an addition to the course: I would have liked to have seen you draw the stuff on paper and how you figured that part out.

results.content: A great course! The lecturer was so interesting and went through each process in such an interactive and logical way.
results.content_html: A great course! The lecturer was so interesting and went through each process in such an interactive and logical way.

results.content: The course is pretty good for complete beginners.  It is easy to understand what instructor meant. Valid for the time and price but I personally learned just few new tags i html5.
results.content_html: The course is pretty good for complete beginners. It is easy to understand what instructor meant. Valid for the time and price but I personally learned just few new tags i html5.

results.content:
This is a great course in wireframing. The course delivers on all of its promises and puts the learner in a great position to start wireframing for their needs.

The course is a port of a course on the Ten Ton Design website. Because of that, there are no quizzes nor are their projects for learners to do. I feel this would have enhanced the course a bit more.

Additionally, the course creator doesn't interact with learners that are taking the course. That would add to the overall benefit of those taking this course.

The course overall is excellent.
results.content_html:
This is a great course in wireframing. The course delivers on all of its promises and puts the learner in a great position to start wireframing for their needs.

The course is a port of a course on the Ten Ton Design website. Because of that, there are no quizzes nor are their projects for learners to do. I feel this would have enhanced the course a bit more.

Additionally, the course creator doesn't interact with learners that are taking the course. That would add to the overall benefit of those taking this course.

The course overall is excellent.

results.content:
I wanted a better understand of wire-framing from both a technical and practical approach.  This course provided both.  It was great to learn that I really did not have to purchase and learn how to use a new application.
The instructor was very prepared and gave simple and clear explanations.  He showed step by step how to accomplish the tasks described in the course.  He also has a great sense of humor which keeps the material from being dry and boring.
The video quality was great.  I could easily see all the text he was typing and sound quality was great as well.
results.content_html:

results.content: I really enjoyed the whole process. It was very helpful in clearing up the process of connecting HTML to CSS and building the foundation of a website.
results.content_html: I really enjoyed the whole process. It was very helpful in clearing up the process of connecting HTML to CSS and building the foundation of a website.

results.content: Totally not what I thought it would be.  Instructor states that he has done the math for the wireframing for us, and yet that is what ​I and a another student wanted to learn about.  Also, the instructor doesn't answer questions.  Not worth the money.
results.content_html: Totally not what I thought it would be. Instructor states that he has done the math for the wireframing for us, and yet that is what ​I and a another student wanted to learn about. Also, the instructor doesn't answer questions. Not worth the money.

results.content:
I really enjoy this instructor's videos.  This particular course isn't quite as comprehensive as the "HTML5 & CSS3 Site Design" and "CSS Floating Layouts" courses, but it's still very good.

I did ask a few questions throughout these three courses that have yet to be answered by the instructor, but given it's just a few days into the new year, it's possible he's on holiday and will answer them at a later date (hopefully).

results.content: Videos was good, sound was good, speed i think was good for beginners. There was few good tips what you can use especially when wireframing or just not having all content yet. Overall it was good course if you are not looking for scaling wireframe website.

results.content: I had a basic knowledge of HTML and CSS and no idea of wireframes. But now as I complete the course I feel confident of making a great wireframe mockup. The teaching is simple and interactive. If you keep coding along instead of just watching it become more fun. All in all good course and would recommend it for sure. Thanks Geoff.

results.content: It can be very frustrating to try to learn about a concept such as wireframes on the web: lots of different definitions of words, different concepts, incomplete information.  This course was wonderful because I now have a consistent understanding of the subject.  I'm hoping the next course on web design will leave me in a like frame of mind. Thank you.

results.content: The course is great so far, although the programs suggested for mocking up wireframes is a bit out of date. Other than that the actual explanation of why to do wireframing and how to start has been great.
results.content_html: The course is great so far, although the programs suggested for mocking up wireframes is a bit out of date. Other than that the actual explanation of why to do wireframing and how to start has been great.

results.content: Very good introduction to HTML/CSS because it's simple and real-world content. This is a great technique in addition to learning how PhotoShop can be used to create wireframes. This is part one of a 2-part series taught by Geoff Blake and I think it could stand alone, but when combined with "Applying Design To Wireframes with HTML5 & CSS3" it really teaches you a quick easy way to design sites. The only feedback I would say is they need to update the course to use modern vscode. The style of writing css is more difficult to understand but vscode would make it easier. So, if you are familiar with using Emmet in vs code then you're ready to take this course.
results.content_html: Very good introduction to HTML/CSS because it's simple and real-world content. This is a great technique in addition to learning how PhotoShop can be used to create wireframes. This is part one of a 2-part series taught by Geoff Blake and I think it could stand alone, but when combined with "Applying Design To Wireframes with HTML5 & CSS3" it really teaches you a quick easy way to design sites. The only feedback I would say is they need to update the course to use modern vscode. The style of writing css is more difficult to understand but vscode would make it easier. So, if you are familiar with using Emmet in vs code then you're ready to take this course.
